The chilly winter breeze,
speaks to me tonight.
The sun's last caress of the mountain's cheek,
Red pink purple -- gone.
Rustling leaves - the last protest.
Moments - these, my happiness.

Speak wind. I will hear your
whispers from the trees.

Far and near: no silence yet, as dogs protest
foreign man or beast
which strayed past his home.

Lay to rest your qualms, your dissatisfaction.
Let be the moment you're in.
Be with it: fears, tears, love and sin.

entry.content: And as we consume our meals of ignorance: breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack, we deny their existence even as we peek the shadow of that gnawing feeling they create. We say aloud in our mind, as if to drown that feeling: "It's ok, it isn't what it really is, this is an exception to the rule, the rational rule. Calm, don't fret, it's but one transgression". And thus one becomes many, finally we find ourselves in the present filled with regret, asking how it all happened. It's obvious how it happened, but probably not to you.

entry.content:
Hello November, you caught me by surprise.

Moments ago I was a boy --
Now I’m faced with the reality
of another year’s memory.

The vast ocean of feelings,
The waves of thought,
The currents of temptation,
The rock solid reality.

In retrospect all things reveal their spectre,
few things are beyond reason,
but looking ahead, an uncertain future awaits.

As the flower blossoms from the peeking sun, it holds no expectation.
As time dances upon the strings of reality
how to regret a note in this melody?
how to regret a human moment?
